articles.author: MOLLY SMITH | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Woman attempts to cross bridge with $20,000 of cocaine
articles.description: HIDALGO — U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers arrested a U.S. citizen Monday attempting to enter Texas with more than 2 pounds of cocaine concealed on her body.

articles.author: MOLLY SMITH | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: More sexual abuse charges pending against former bus driver
articles.description: The Hidalgo County Sheriff’s Office confirmed Tuesday it is investigating additional child sexual abuse cases involving a former charter school bus driver.

articles.title: Federal judge again denies bond for indicted doctor
articles.description: McALLEN — Jorge Zamora-Quezada, the doctor facing federal charges of healthcare fraud, was again held without bond Tuesday, a decision his defense attorney quipped is usually reserved for the likes of drug lords.

articles.author: Clint Rainey
articles.title: After a Beloved Restaurateur Was Deported, It Only Took a Year for His Community to Move On
articles.description: Roberto Beristain’s shocking deportation made national headlines. Now a Washington Post report finds that his town has largely forgotten him.

articles.author: BERENICE GARCIA | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Doctor's trial pushed to September
articles.description: McALLEN — The pending trial for a rheumatologist who in May was arrested on charges of healthcare fraud has been pushed to September after a federal judge on Friday ruled it a “complex” case.

articles.author: Molly Hennessy-Fiske
articles.title: The great test for Trump's border wall: Texas' Rio Grande Valley
articles.description: Congress approved $1.6 billion to build 100 miles of border wall, a third in the heavily trafficked Rio Grande Valley, but it's not clear where and why.

articles.title: NEWS: Van Gogh Museum in Amsterdam Draws Record Number of Visitors for 2017

articles.author: BY BERENICE GARCIA | STAFF WRITER
articles.title: Embattled doctor’s son: No-bond left patients in limbo
articles.description: EDINBURG — Posted on the front door of the Arthritis & Osteoporosis Centers here is a sign asking patients to show their support for Jorge Zamora-Quezada, the rheumatologist who was arrested last month on charges of healthcare fraud.

articles.author: Kate Linthicum
articles.title: For a deported man and his family, an uneasy ‘homecoming’ in Mexico
articles.description: Roberto Tetatzin knew he was going to be deported to his native Mexico. Now he and his partner, Judith Cristal Gudino, would have to decide what to do next. Should the girls stay in the U.S. with Gudino, or should the whole family relocate to Mexico?
